references.paper_title: A globally asymptotically stable polynomial vector field with no polynomial Lyapunov function
references.reason: This paper presents a counterexample to a long-standing conjecture in control theory, showing that not all globally asymptotically stable polynomial systems possess a polynomial Lyapunov function, directly relevant to the core problem of the current research.

references.paper_title: Classical converse theorems in Lyapunov's second method
references.reason: This paper provides crucial theoretical background on converse Lyapunov theorems, which are central to understanding the existence and properties of Lyapunov functions, a core topic of the current research.

references.paper_title: The general problem of the stability of motion
references.reason: This seminal work introduced the concept of Lyapunov functions and their connection to the stability of dynamical systems, forming the foundational basis for the entire field of research that the current paper builds upon.

references.paper_title: Introducing SOSTOOLS: A general purpose sum of squares programming solver
references.reason: This paper introduced SOSTOOLS, a software package for solving sum-of-squares (SOS) programs, a critical tool used to find Lyapunov functions for polynomial systems and used as a benchmark in the current work.

This paper expands on the capabilities and applications of SOSTOOLS, providing further details on its use in solving control problems and demonstrating its relevance to the research on Lyapunov functions presented in the current paper.
